p: NiV is an enveloped pleomorphic virus belonging to the genus Henipavirus of the family Paramyxoviridae [ 14]. The genome of the virus consists of a non-segmented negative sense single-stranded RNA of approximately 18.2 kb long which encodes six structural proteins: nucleocapsid (N), phosphoprotein (P), matrix protein (M), fusion protein (F), glycoprotein (G) and RNA polymerase (L) [ 15]. The N, P and L along with the viral RNA forms the ribonucleoprotein complex, an indispensable complex that regulates transcription and viral RNA synthesis ( Figure 1).
